sentence.Network_cn: 新建成的购物中心耗资110万。

sentence.Network_en: Now we live further away from the city centre.
sentence.Network_cn: 现在我们住得离市中心更远了。

jx.jx_en_mean: a person or thing that excites everyone's interest or concern
jx.jx_cn_mean: 注意力的焦点，众人瞩目的人（或物）

jx.jx_en_mean: a place where the highest standards are maintained
jx.jx_cn_mean: 维持最高标准之处，工作精益求精之处

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French, or from Latin centrum, from Greek kentron 'sharp point, stationary point of a pair of compasses', related to kentein 'to prick'

entry.def: A centre is a building where people have meetings, take part in a particular activity, or get help of some kind.

example.ex: We went to a party at the leisure centre...
example.tran: 我们去休闲中心参加一个聚会。

example.ex: She now also does pottery classes at a community centre.
example.tran: 她现在还在社区中心上陶艺课。

entry.def: If an area or town is a centre for an industry or activity, that industry or activity is very important there.

example.ex: London is also the major international insurance centre.
example.tran: 伦敦也是重要的国际保险中心。

entry.def: The centre of something is the middle of it.

example.ex: A large wooden table dominates the centre of the room...
example.tran: 一张大木桌摆在房间正中央。

example.ex: Bake until light golden and crisp around the edges and slightly soft in the centre.
example.tran: 烤至边缘浅黄松脆，中间略软。

entry.tran: (市镇的)商业中心，闹市区，繁华地带
entry.def: The centre of a town or city is the part where there are the most shops and businesses and where a lot of people come from other areas to work or shop.
If something or someone is at the centre of a situation, they are the most important thing or person involved.

example.ex: ...the man at the centre of the controversy...
At the centre of the inquiry has been concern for the pensioners involved.
example.tran: 调查的核心一直是对于牵涉其中的领取养老金者的关注。

entry.def: If someone or something is the centre of attention or interest, people are giving them a lot of attention.

example.ex: The rest of the cast was used to her being the centre of attention...
example.tran: 她总是人们关注的焦点，其他演职人员对此已经习以为常。

example.ex: The centre of attraction was Pierre Auguste Renoir's oil painting.
example.tran: 最吸引人注意的是皮埃尔·奥古斯特·雷诺阿的油画。

entry.def: In politics, the centre refers to groups and their beliefs, when they are considered to be neither left-wing nor right-wing.

example.ex: The Democrats have become a party of the centre.
example.tran: 民主党成了中立的党派。

entry.def: If you centre something, you move it so that it is at the centre of something else.

example.ex: Centre the design on the cloth before you start.
example.tran: 在开始前，将图案放在布的正中间。

entry.tran: （使）以…为中心;（使）注意力集中于
entry.def: If something centres or is centred on a particular thing or person, that thing or person is the main subject of attention.

example.ex: ...a plan which centred on academic  achievement and personal motivation...
example.tran: 重点强调学术成就和个人兴趣的计划

example.ex: All his concerns were centred around himself rather than Rachel...
example.tran: 他所关心的全是他自己，而不是雷切尔。

entry.def: If an industry or event is centred in a place, or if it centres there, it takes place to the greatest extent there.

example.ex: The fighting has been centred around the town of Vucovar...
example.tran: 战斗主要集中在武科瓦尔镇周围。

example.ex: The disturbances have centred round the two main university areas...
example.tran: 骚乱主要发生在两所大学附近的区域。

means.word_mean: 1. an area that is approximately central within some larger region;

sentences.sentence: "it is in the center of town"
"they ran forward into the heart of the struggle"
"they were in the eye of the storm"

means.word_mean: 2. a point equidistant from the ends of a line or the extremities of a figure
3. a place where some particular activity is concentrated;
4. the sweet central portion of a piece of candy that is enclosed in chocolate or some other covering
5. a cluster of nerve cells governing a specific bodily process;

sentences.sentence: "in most people the speech center is in the left hemisphere"

means.word_mean: 6. a building dedicated to a particular activity;

sentences.sentence: "they were raising money to build a new center for research"
"That vase in the picture is not centered"
"Please focus on your studies and not on your hobbies"

centr中心+e→n.中心, 中央 v.集中
concentrate[v.集中;浓缩]+ion动作或状态→concentration集中;浓缩

con共同+centr中心+ate做→中心共同→集中

It is at the centre of the fashion industry.
It will be used as a centre for athletic training
Even so, the shift in the centre of gravity to older age groups is bound to have a profound effect on societies, not just economically and politically but in all sorts of other ways too.

sentences.cn: 他是这次事件的核心人物。

sentences.cn: 这事发生在演习的过程中。
